metadata.Title: CVE-2019-13376 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
phpBB version 3.2.7 allows the stealing of an Administration Control Panel session id by leveraging CSRF in the Remote Avatar feature. The CSRF Token Hijacking leads to stored XSS It was discovered that phpBB has a XSS vulnerability. An attacker could possibly use this do cause a Denial of Service or execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-13376` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

phpbb3 - 3.0.12-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
phpbb3-l10n - 3.0.12-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: phpbb3 package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.0.12-1ubuntu0.1~esm1').
